65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (11:14): replied to the EOT thread
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (11:23): I accidentally said something totally wrong
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (11:23): but at least I corrected myself!
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (11:23): I do think Bert's report sounded extremely biased
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (11:23): like I said in my email, he attributed all arguments against EOT to others, but wrote the rebuttals to those arguments in authorial voice as facts
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (11:24): so either he is openly stating that he's pro-EOT, or he is a really bad writer
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (11:24): that's ignoring anything about the quality of arguments on either side
42e76c77af424a4350ab0e3e3f6f2ce9 (11:28): the compactness of the notes in my 2008 collection are really helping me count up the trends
42e76c77af424a4350ab0e3e3f6f2ce9 (11:28): yay for notepad, pen and remembering how to tally from primary school :)
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (11:28): hmm I wonder if David Orchard is it
4d647473081c3ad729446a01a377813b (11:34): looking forward to Sunday!

4d647473081c3ad729446a01a377813b (11:39): though if vertical text is discussed you really want to be somewhere else :p

cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (11:42): ok i so got the algorithm wrong :(
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (11:43): in webkit, <body bgcolor=999> results in rgb(0, 9, 153) while <body bgcolor=aaa> results in rgb(170, 170, 170)
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (11:44): and <body bgcolor=aax> results in rgb(0, 0, 0)
42e76c77af424a4350ab0e3e3f6f2ce9 (11:45): 4d647473081c3ad729446a01a377813b, do I contact Bert Bos about observing CSSWG meetings?
42e76c77af424a4350ab0e3e3f6f2ce9 (11:46): "W3C Style Activity Lead" & "CSS contact" are the roles in the footer of different parts of the public CSS pages
4d647473081c3ad729446a01a377813b (11:46): I think you need to contact the chairs
4d647473081c3ad729446a01a377813b (11:46): plinss and glazou
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (11:47): i think i'll just make valid #rgb notation return and anything else continue the algorithm

42e76c77af424a4350ab0e3e3f6f2ce9 (11:49): 4d647473081c3ad729446a01a377813b, ah I just found http://www.w3.org/Style/2008/css-charter but and I have Daniel Glazman's e-mail from Public-HTML, but I can't find e-mail address for Peter Linss. Should I keep looking or just contact Daniel?
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (11:53): 42e76c77af424a4350ab0e3e3f6f2ce9: wow, he works fast
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:00): that member-only thread has missed some relevant points, like the way that I (we) are actively working with the SVGWG on the SVG-in-text/html thing
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:02): and the way that html5 was originally outside the w3c, and it was only the w3c asking for it to be brought into the w3c that changed that
4d647473081c3ad729446a01a377813b (12:03): http://blog.whatwg.org/october-2008-meetups
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (12:03): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: I think some people involved in that discussion aren't really aware of the history.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:03): so it seems a bit weird to be demanding that html5 use w3c culture as opposed to the other way around
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:04): (though as Bijan points out, in practice the culture is the same, it's just a different focus)

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:04): (i'd say the whatwg culture is probably a bit more honest about what it means, whereas the w3c one is put in a more politically correct fashion, but that's about it)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:04): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: clearly
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:05): I hope Bijan will be at the TPAC. I've no idea who he is, but I should thank him for his kind words.

a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (13:21): hmmm
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (13:24): IIS is odd.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (13:31): HTTP/1.x style requests with method = "get" result in 404; HTTP/0.9 style requests result in invalid request
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (13:33): It seems to return 404 and not 501 for any unknown method, get included
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (13:33): Yeah
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (13:34): Case-sensitive for requests, case-insensitive for responses
4d647473081c3ad729446a01a377813b (13:34): how can you be case-insensitive there?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (13:35): good question.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (13:35): I'm too tired :)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (13:36): Unusually, Apache is just as strict as IIS
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (13:36): (IIS tends to be stricter)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (13:49): I ought to write some way to test stuff automagically
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (13:49): (like, for requests)
